title: Album Page, "Latch Plate and Door Handle from Salle des Etats, Blois", June 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 44; bottom right corner: 37; from left (written on ruled lines): Key Hole / Full size; Latch plate and Handle / on Outside of Door of / Salle des Etats / Blois June 1888- ; 1/2 full size; Top view of Thumb plate / full size.
description: Vertical sheet with three drawings illustrating door hardware.  At center is a long metal plate ending in a fleur-de-lys at top and bottom, with a modeled rectangular handled and thumb plate.  To the left of this is a small drawing of a key hole.  To the right is a view in plan of the thumb plate shown only in elevation in the drawing at center.  The thumb plate is made up of three small round balls that project from a narrow strip of metal.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Latch Plate and Door Handle from Salle des Etats, Blois", June 1888.Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-210.
